com.ibm.mobile.services.location.geo.triggers

Class IBMAbstractGeoAreaTrigger

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ibm.mobile.services.location.IBMAbstractTrigger
      • com.ibm.mobile.services.location.geo.triggers.IBMGeoTrigger
        • com.ibm.mobile.services.location.geo.triggers.IBMAbstractGeoAreaTrigger
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    IBMGeoAreaTrigger, IBMGeoDwellTrigger

    public abstract class IBMAbstractGeoAreaTrigger
extends IBMGeoTrigger
    Defines parameters for Geo-Triggers with area considerations The IBMAbstractGeoAreaTrigger class is a provisional API. APIs that are marked provisional are evolving and might change or be removed in future releases.

    • Method Detail

      • getArea

        public IBMArea getArea()
        Returns:
        The trigger's area.

      • getBufferZoneWidth

        public double getBufferZoneWidth()
        Returns:
        The trigger's buffer zone width. The value indicates in meters how much to change the area. It can have either a positive or negative value. If it has a positive value, the area becomes bigger. If it has a negative value, the area becomes smaller. All geofence triggers operate on this new area. The default value is 0, which leaves the area unchanged.

      • setArea

        public void setArea(IBMPolygon polygon)
        Sets the trigger area to the geometry defined by the IBMPolygon For polygons with multiple rings, only the outer ring will be considered.
        Parameters:
        polygon - the polygon defining the area for which the trigger will activate.

      • setArea

        public void setArea(IBMPosition center,
           double radius)
        Sets the trigger area to a circular geometry defined by the IBMPosition and radius.
        Parameters:
        center -
        radius - in meters

      • setArea

        public void setArea(IBMPoint center,
           double radius)
        Sets the trigger area to a circular geometry defined by the IBMPoint and radius.
        Parameters:
        center -
        radius - in meters

      • setBufferZoneWidth

        public void setBufferZoneWidth(double bufferZoneWidth)
        Parameters:
        bufferZoneWidth - the bufferZoneWidth to set. Its value indicates in meters how much to change the area. It can have either a positive or negative value. If it has a positive value, the area becomes bigger. If it has a negative value, the area becomes smaller. All geofence triggers operate on this new area. The default value is 0, which leaves the area unchanged.

      • getConfidenceLevel

        public IBMConfidenceLevel getConfidenceLevel()
        Returns:
        the confidenceLevel. This indicates how a position's accuracy is to be taken into account.
        See Also:
        IBMConfidenceLevel

      • setConfidenceLevel

        public void setConfidenceLevel(IBMConfidenceLevel confidenceLevel)
        Parameters:
        confidenceLevel - the confidenceLevel to set. This indicates how a position's accuracy is to be taken into account.
        See Also:
        IBMConfidenceLevel
